author: Staff reports
title: Tuesday's local sports roundup
text: By Staff reports Posted Oct. 13, 2015 at 10:54 pm Updated at 11:24 PM COLLEGE MEN’S GOLF Nick Stafford took the Belmont Abbey Invitational individual title by four strokes with rounds of 69 and 75, leading the Crusaders to the team title as well by just one shot over Limestone. Belmont Abbey B team member Maurizio DeBono tied for the low score of the tournament’s final day with a 73. COLLEGE WOMEN’S GOLF Belmont Abbey’s women’s golf team shot its lowest round of the fall, a 318, in the final round of the Patsy Rendleman Invitational at the Country Club of Salisbury to finish ninth of the 14 teams. Haley Helton was the top Crusader for the tournament after a first-round 83 and final-round 76, which put her in a tie for 17th. Anne Parlmer wasn’t far behind with rounds of 83 and 77, which tied her for 20th. VARSITY FOOTBALL Today through Friday, tickets to the South Point vs. Forestview game will be on sale to the public in both schools’ front offices. Tickets are $6, and the offices will be open until 3:30 p.m. all week. Game time is 7:30 p.m. Friday at Forestview High, and the gates will open at 6 p.m. VARSITY BOYS SOCCER Gaston Christian 3, Gaston Day 0 — Jacob Foster (two goals), Joshua Putnam (goal), Davis McBee and Caleb Thornburg (one assist each) led the offense in front of goalie Austin Helms’ shutout in the MAC semifinal win for Gaston Christian (14-6-1), which hosts Hickory Grove at 7 p.m. Thursday in the MAC championship game. Kings Mountain 7, Cherryville 0 — Josh Scism and Weston Harmon had two goals each, Brian Lysek, Mason Nguyen and Nolan Raby added a goal apiece and the combined shutout was Kings Mountain’s ninth of the season. The Mountaineers (13-3) play at West Lincoln today. VARSITY GIRLS VOLLEYBALL Forestview 3, Ashbrook 0 (25-22, 26-24, 25-14) — Morgan Ginther (12 kills, two aces), Leah Smith (five kills, four aces), Mikayla Thorpe (12 assists, two aces), Carey Horne (11 assists, ace) and Taylor Johnson (five kills, ace) led Forestview (12-9, 8-4), which travels to Kings Mountain today. Cherryville 3, Highland Tech 1 (25-13, 25-17, 22-25, 25-14) — Bayleigh Henley (36 assists, four aces), Courtney Hay (11 kills) and Megan Williams (20 digs) led Cherryville (19-5) in the first-round win of the conference tournament. Cherryville’s second-round game is 6 p.m. today at Community School of Davidson. North Gaston 3, East Gaston 0 (25-18, 25-17, 25-17) — Kaycee Bradley (31 assists, two digs), Sydney Edwards (four aces, 15 kills, 22 digs), Erin Edwards (four aces, 11 kills, 16 digs, block), Emily Martin (four aces, eight digs), Stacie Newton (11 digs) and Josie Allred (two aces, three kills, nine digs) led North Gaston (14-2, 12-0), which travels to South Point on Thursday. Gaston Christian 3, Westminster Catawba 0 (25-23, 25-21, 26-24) — Ashlyn Freeman (nine kills, two blocks), Lily Chapman (seven aces, eight kills, 10 digs) and Alexis Bean (six kills) led Gaston Christian (14-8, 10-2) to the MAC semifinal win. Gaston Christian plays Southlake Christian for the MAC championship at 5:30 p.m. Thursday at Gaston Day. Stuart Cramer 3, Hunter Huss 1 (25-17, 25-14, 25-27, 25-18) — Laura Trull (nine kills, four aces, five blocks, Annelle Grealis (nine kills, four aces) and Kassie Fowler (four kills, 33 assists) led Stuart Cramer (14-6, 7-5), which travels to East Gaston on Thursday. Southlake Christian 3, Gaston Day 1 (25-12, 22-25, 25-16, 25-17) VARSITY GIRLS GOLF At Riverbend Golf Club, Shelby (Monday) — Kings Mountain shot a 161 to finish in third place behind co-medalist Natalie Lutz’s 43. Final South Mountain 2A/3A golf standings: No. 1 East Burke, No. 2 Crest, No. 3 Kings Mountain, No. 4 Draughn. Lutz and Sarah Drennan made the all-conference team for Kings Mountain, and Lutz qualified for the Western 3A Regional Tournament to be played Tuesday at Monroe Country Club. JV GIRLS VOLLEYBALL Forestview 2, Ashbrook 0 (25-10, 25-12) — Ashten Mullis (seven kills, two aces), Aleaha Duncan (five kills, ace), Carolina Swaim (13 assists, two aces) and Caroline Cabe (10 digs, two aces) led Forestview (9-10, 6-6), which travels to Kings Mountain today. Stuart Cramer 2, Hunter Huss 0 (25-18, 25-13) — Kellston Gantt, Sophie Matz and Maddie Short had four aces each, while Kendall Craig and Maddie Short contributed five kills apiece for Stuart Cramer. MIDDLE SCHOOL SOFTBALL Chavis 12, Belmont 0, 4 innings — Kirsten Goodman picked up the win, Gracie Hester went 3 for 3 and Sarah Word, Faith Anthony and Goodman each had two hits for Chavis (11-0), which advances to Tuesday’s championship game. Belmont ends its season at 7-4. W.C. Friday 13, Bessemer City 2, 5 innings — Kristen Huggler and Savannah Baldwin (also the winning pitcher) each had two hits, including Baldwin’s home run, and Mallory Canup and Sydney Hamilton had two hits apiece for W.C. Friday (10-1), which advances to Tuesday’s championship game. Bessemer City’s season ends at 8-3. East Rutherford 9, Kings Mountain 1 MIDDLE SCHOOL BOYS SOCCER Kings Mountain 2, East Rutherford 0 — Christian Quevedo Johns, assisted by Josh Visoso, and Tristan Stenger provided the goals. Kings Mountain (3-5) travels to RS Central on Tuesday.
